intro: Tibouchina strigosa, commonly known as the velvetleaf tibouchina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy clusters of pink or purple flowers. The plant belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Tibouchina strigosa is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
